summary: In Greek mythology, Hades is the god of the dead and ruler of the underworld. He was the eldest son of Cronus and Rhea and, together with his brothers Zeus and Poseidon, defeated the Titans. They divided the universe, with Hades ruling the underworld, Zeus the sky, and Poseidon the sea. Hades is often shown with a bident and a helmet, accompanied by Cerberus, the three-headed guard dog. The Romans later associated Hades with their god Pluto, a name meaning "the rich one."
title: Hades
